name: teutonically
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
in a way that is thought to be typical of the groups of people in northwestern Europe of German origin : For young people living in West Germany in the 1960s, the years of free love and revolution were filtered through a Teutonically serious sensibility. Originally from Frankfurt, the professor was teutonically thorough and somewhat intimidating.
More examplesFewer examplesHe was Teutonically disciplined and trained by running five miles every day. As a designer, he was was teutonically stark and minimal.
